DateText: late 11th century AH/AD 17th century-early 12th century AH/AD 18th century
Title: Map of the Bay of Kerme East of Cos Island
Medium: ink and pigments on laid European paper
Description: This folio from Walters manuscript W.658 contains a map of the Bay of Kerme east of Cos (Stancho, Istanköy) Island.
Keywords: Art; Binding; Codex; Colophon; Headpiece; History; Illumination; Illustration; Islamic; Manuscript; Ornament; Painting; Turkish; Cartography; Geography
Provenance: Ahmad Afandi [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [see folio 4a]; Ali Afandi [date and mode of acquisiton unknown] [see folio 4a]; Sayyid Ali Qapudan [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [see folio 1a]; Sultan Mahmud Khan [date and mode of acquistion unknown] [waqf seal and followed by a bequest statement (now erased), and the seal of the inspector of wakfs, Mustafá Tahir, see folio 4a]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Piri Reis (Turkish, 1465-1555)
